document.heading: Resolution of the Kiowa Tribe Legislature Authorizing the Bureau of Indian Affairs Anadarko Agency and the Chairman of the Tribe to Safeguard, Proceed, and Execute Leases for the Kiowa Tribe 100% Owned Farming and Grazing Leases and Oil and Gas Leases, and Right-of-Way Encumbrances, that are under the Authority of the Kiowa Tribe Executive Branch

recital.text: the Kiowa Tribe is a federally recognized Indian Tribe with a constitution approved by the Secretary of the Interior, and designed to safeguard tribal rights, powers, and privileges to improve the economic, moral, educational, and health status of its members; and
the Legislature is vested with the authority to pass laws and resolutions pursuant to Article VI, Section 6(a) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe; and
the Kiowa Tribe owns 100% that are currently being leased through the Kiowa Tribe Property Department; and

that the Kiowa Tribe Legislature hereby allows the Bureau of Indian Affairs to proceed with and execute 100% owned Kiowa Tribe leases and hereby gives the Kiowa Tribal Chairman the authority to sign all leases that are held at the Bureau of Indian Affairs Anadarko Agency.

that the Legislature hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "Resolution of the Kiowa Tribe Legislature authorizing the Bureau of Indian Affairs Anadarko Agency and the Chairman of the Tribe to safeguard, proceed, and execute leases for the Kiowa Tribe 100% owned farming and grazing leases that are leased under the authority of the Kiowa Tribe Executive Branch".

procedural-data.text: The foregoing Resolution KL-CY-2023-005, was duly voted upon by the Kiowa Tribe Legislature at a duly called Regular Session, LXIX, January 14, 2023, with a vote of (6)-Yes, (0)-No, (0)-Abstain, and (1)- Absent, pursuant to the authority vested in the Legislature by the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe.

CO-SPONSOR(S): Michael Primus, Speaker/District #2; Anita Johnson, Secretary/District #5; Kyle Ataddlety, District #1; Timothy Satepauhoodle, District #3, Alana Quetone, District #4, Warren Queton, District #7.

text.b: DELIVERY OF THE RESOLUTION AND LAW TO THE CHAIRMAN

procedural-data.text: Resolution No. KL-CY-2023-005 was presented to the Chairman of the Kiowa Tribe on the _____ day of January, 2023, pursuant to the Article VI, Section 8(a)(iv) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe, and will become effective after signature by the Chairman or veto override by the Legislature, and as otherwise required by the Constitution.

section.heading: Title.
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the, "Resolution of the Kiowa Tribe Legislature authorizing the Bureau of Indian Affairs Anadarko Agency and the Chairman of the Tribe to safeguard, proceed, and execute leases for the Kiowa Tribe 100% owned farming and grazing leases that are leased under the authority of the Kiowa Tribe Executive Branch". ("Farming and Grazing Leasing Act").

section.heading: Findings.
section.text: The Kiowa Tribe owns 100% farming and grazing leases that are currently being leased through the Kiowa Tribe Property Department.

section.heading: Authorization to Negotiate and Execute Leases.
section.text: The Legislature hereby authorizes and allows the Bureau of Indian Affairs to proceed with and execute 100% owned Kiowa Tribe leases for farming and grazing and giving the Kiowa Tribal Chairman the authority to sign all farming and grazing leases that are held at the Bureau of Indian Affairs Anadarko Agency.

section.heading: Expiration of Authorization.
section.text: The authority granted to the Office of Chairman pursuant to this Farming and Grazing Leasing Act shall not expire.

section.heading: Reporting.
section.text: The Chairman or his designee shall provide the Legislature with a copy of each lease executed on behalf of the Tribe, pursuant to the authority granted in this Farming and Grazing Leasing Act within thirty (30) days of execution.
